alert.note: Alert for Brown (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 03 at 3:07PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL BROWN AND SOUTHWESTERN KEWAUNEE COUNTIES... At 306 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bellevue Town, or 9 miles southeast of Green Bay, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Brown and southwestern Kewaunee Counties, including the following locations... Norman, Curran, Ellisville, Pilsen, Poland, Humboldt, Cherneyville, Bolt, Neuern and Stangelville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
